availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisiana, Confederate Secretary of War, State, and Attorney General. Native of the West Indies. Married to Natalie Benjamin. Father of Ann L. Benjamin. Admitted to the bar in New Orleans, Louisiana in 1833. U.S. Senator from Louisiana from 1852 to 1861. First attorney general of the Confederacy from February 25, 1861 to September 1861. Secretary of War of the Confederacy from September 1861 to March 1862. Secretary of State of the Confederacy from March 1862 until the end of the Civil War. Moved to England in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Louisiana, Orleans, New Orleans Ward 1, p. 153.
"Judah Philip Benjamin," National Parks Service, November 10, 2018, https://www.nps.gov/people/judah-philip-benjamin.htm (accessed December 19, 2019).
